title: Building Trust
content: Trust is built through consistent behavior over time: doing what you say, following through, admitting mistakes, sharing credit, having others' backs. It's destroyed quickly by inconsistency, blame-shifting, or betrayal. Trust is an asset requiring ongoing investment.

mcq.question: A team member makes a mistake. How should the team respond to build trust?

options.A: Hold them accountable publicly to maintain standards
options.B: Focus on learning and prevention rather than blame

mcq.explanation: Blame responses reduce future error reporting. Learning responses maintain information flow while still addressing the issue. 'What can we learn?' builds trust. 'Whose fault was it?' destroys it.

openQuestions: What actions have built trust in your teams?
What has damaged trust, and was it repairable?
